reviews.title: Tasty but too expensive
reviews.text: Good food with 3 teenagers. Convenient with tablet ordering at the table. Friendly service and friendly staff. Price for the food is unclear. From the age of 12, children pay full price. The drinks will get over this. On the card is a text that can be read differently in terms of price for children. The owner is going to adjust this.

tips.body: Heb je jonge kinderen reken dan goed uit hoeveel je kwijt bent. Vanaf 12 jaar zowiezo de volle mep

reviews.title: Not a nice restaurant
reviews.text: We actually always came here, and was always super nice restaurant and the service is also very nice and good food. Now they have completely changed it inside plus the menu and I find it very disappointing. Little choice and especially very different choice than what they have always done and that you can only have 1 dish per round I thought was crazy but good. I wouldn't recommend it myself since they changed it, the concept is not for us.

reviews.title: Restaurant without taste
reviews.text: If you are a gourmet then I would not recommend this restaurant. In the salmon salad were some cubes of salmon that had no taste at all. All the nigiri sushi had way too much rice under it so you didn't taste the salmon at all. Also the lobster soup unfortunately had no taste at all. The meat dishes such as steak, lamb chops tasted like nothing which is actually weird for example lamb chops that already have their own taste. In the ministry, someone was sneezing very loudly all the time which you heard constantly throughout the whole thing and then went back to the ministry. For us, this was a one-time visit.

reviews.title: Next Level Sushi Restaurant
reviews.text:
Today I went to the new Hachi, now Hachi Sushi & Fusion. The restaurant has had a Makeover and looks beautiful. The mass of other well-known sushi restaurant is absolutely not experienced here. You can order one dish at a time and a side dish. If that is not enough, you can order an extra sushi dish the first round. The food is exquisite, the portions large enough Everything is prepared by themselves and is super tasty. The food is served on beautiful crockery. The sushi is delicious as are the tepan dishes where the meat is deliciously soft.
The staff is friendly and you don't have to wait long after you order. This is a next level Sushi restaurant in short a must!

reviews.title: Too busy, maybe say no for once!
reviews.text:
Very busy, which the kitchen and service are not equipped for. We did not receive several ordered dishes and they did take a very long time. Asked several times and received no answer. The bill was complete, no further response to my comments.
Normally good now a lot less!

reviews.title: Fresh sushi
reviews.text:
It is always nice to eat sushi there. They are very fresh. Shabu shabu has a concurrent in Alphen.
We never can finish the 5 rounds.

reviews.title: Still great food - easier ordering via tablet.
reviews.text: I eat at Hachi two or three times a year when I am in Alphen visiting my son and his family. It has always been very enjoyable and good value for money with fast, friendly service and a menu that usually has something new each time I go.  This time the ordering was even easier with a 'tablet provided for each table that sends orders straight through to the chefs. It was my son's birthday on the day we went and they acknowledged this with a lovely desert topped by a sparkler! As always, a lovely evening with authentic Japanese sushi and a great buzz.'

additionalNames.name: Alphen aan den Rijn
additionalNames.long: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands

reviews.title: We both got sick
reviews.text: Great concept, bad execution. Just have a standard price, eat as much as you can and if you dont eat your plate you pay more. The sushi is bad, leaves are dry because they make them ours before consumption. Half an our after leaving the restauraunt we end up in the restrooms. No fun.

additionalNames.name: Alphen aan den Rijn
additionalNames.long: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands

reviews.title: Heerlijke sushi
reviews.text: Good sushi, all you can eat. The restaurant is situated next to the train station of Alphen aan den Rijn.

additionalNames.name: Koudekerk aan den Rijn
additionalNames.long: Koudekerk aan den Rijn, The Netherlands

reviews.title: Tasteful sushi and smiling service
reviews.text: Excellent sushi, rapidly served with an oriental smile. All feest and very tasteful. The waitresses are very helpful and the food is served quickly.

additionalNames.name: Alphen aan den Rijn
additionalNames.long: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands

reviews.title: Excellent Sushi restaurant
reviews.text: The restaurant serve various Sushi products. For everybody something. Even if you do not like Fish you can eat yourself full.

reviews.title: Yummy
reviews.text: Well, what should I say, I love sushi, anytime anywhere. Visited Hachi with my girlfriend and did the 'as much as you can eat' -thing. It was great, love the dishes with eel. The service is great and one advice: book a table in advance, the place is always full.

reviews.title: Fabulous food, great service!
reviews.text: Hachi is very good value for money and an excellent way to sample a wide range of authentic Japanese food. There are five courses and within each course you can choose three, four or five different items.  I have never yet managed to eat the full amount - but there is always a youngster to help out!  The staff are trained to watch the tables all the time so that as soon as you are ready to order the next course your choices are noted and the food arrives very quickly. All in all it is is fun place to eat and somewhere you will want to return to again and again.

additionalNames.name: Alphen aan den Rijn
additionalNames.long: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands

reviews.title: still oke, but.
reviews.text:
It was not the first time we ate at Hachi in Alphen aan den Rijn. But we did visit other restaurants of the same concept in the meantime. Hachi has decreased it value. The number of portions have decreased by 20 %, also the amount per portion has decreased as well. Moreover the portions look as prefabricated in stead of amde in their own kitchen.
We do like the food, however, the quality dercrease will mean that we will not go their anymore for a nice night out, just for a meal.

additionalNames.name: Alphen aan den Rijn
additionalNames.long: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands

reviews.title: perfect concept
reviews.text: This new restaurant is booming because of its new concept: one orders 5 Japanese same plates, like tapas in Spain, one can doe that up to 5 times for one, reasonable price. With Sake, it is very nice and the food is good. One can eat either fish or meat,  whatever one likes.

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!

articleContent.title: 7 tips for traveling with food allergies

seoInfo.metaDescription: Don’t let your allergies get in the way of a good vacation.
It’s a privilege to visit the world’s most beautiful oceans. Celebrate World Oceans Day by learning how to protect them.

tripContent.title: Enter the unknown: Nevada’s wildest hidden realms
tripContent.description: Strange, surreal, and totally unforgettable, this is Nevada off the rails. From alien highways to haunted hotels, and from outdoor art playgrounds to eccentric ghost towns, this route is made for the curious traveler. Embrace the uncommon and uncover a different side of the Silver State, where ever stop feels like a secret waiting to be stumbled upon.

articleContent.title: Our go-to guide to hotels in New York City

seoInfo.metaDescription: We break it down—6 hotels for every personality, from solo travelers to theater lovers.

articleContent.title: 5 national parks that put accessibility first
